result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin P Maple

defendant.name: Maple, Justin P
defendant.address: W5126 County Road V, Sheldon, WI 54766

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DE has indicated undecided at this time about seeking PCR

Defendant Justin P Maple in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF25, 15CF26.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
14CF113-Nc to amended Ct 1, 943.14, NC to Ct 3. Ct's 2,4,5 will be DRI.  

15CF25-NC to amended Ct 2 961.41(3g)(d),  Ct 1-DRI
15CF26-DRI

Court will withhold sentence, 2 yrs probation, each count, concurrent, no contact with the victims, no contact with Sheps Bar and Campground, DE will pay Rest of 4942.03, J/S with Darren Bishop (15CF12), will obtain his GED or HSED, maintain regular employment, make regular payments on restitution,  DE will maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol possession or consumption, no possession of illicit substances or drugs without a valid prescription, no possession of any mind altering illegal substances,  has credit for 10 days, DE will be eligible for expunction upon successful completion of probation.  Will write apology letters to victims if desired by them, letter will be approved by DOC Agent.

Defendant Justin P Maple in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF25, 15CF26.  Arrignment in 15CF25, 15CF26-waive reading of information, enter plea of NG to all counts.  Atty would like more time to discuss cases with DA.

DE MUST LIVE WITH HIS MOTHER AFTER RELEASE FROM JAIL.  DE MUST GO DIRECTLY TO SEE JEREMY JACOBS AFTER RELEASE.  CANNOT POSSESS, USE OR BE ANYWHERE THERE ARE ILLICIT DRUGS.  NO CONTACT WITH SHEP'S NORTHSIDE BAR.  BOND CONCURRENT TO 14CF113, 15CF25

Defendant Justin P Maple in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF25, 15CF26-INIT APP-  Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint.  Bonds will be concurrent to 14CF113.  Waive time limits for prelim hearing, will waive prelim hearings also.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim hearing.  Court will find probable cause, will bind over for JT in both cases.   30 days to file information, then set for arraignment.
